thread.title: 36 Ways To Add Storage To Everything You Own
thread.title_full: 36 Ways To Add Storage To Everything You Own

author: Elena Garcia
title: 36 Ways To Add Storage To Everything You Own
text:
View this image ›
Jenny Chang / BuzzFeed We hope you love the products we recommend! Just so you know, BuzzFeed may collect a share of sales from the links on this page.
ID: 10400086 1. Store your sheets in their matching pillow case or buy a reusable storage bag that lets you move them with ease. Photograph by Raymond Hom. Courtesy of Martha Stewart Living. ©2011 / Via marthastewart.com , amazon.com Get the storage container on Amazon for $7 .
ID: 10388605 2. Get sliding racks for your cabinets to store food, dishes, and cookware. amazon.com , amazon.com Get this one on Amazon starting at $81 .
Available in 12”, 15”, 18”, and 21” options.
ID: 10390651 3. Get an ottoman that includes a storage compartment to create extra space in the middle of any room. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $53 .
Also available in beige, black, and green.
ID: 10387847 4. And place a bench with open storage in your entryway for easy access to the things you need when you’re running out the door. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon starting at $50 .
Available in white, espresso, and cherry.
ID: 10388208 5. Create under-sink storage with adjustable shelves that fit around your pipes. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $25 .
ID: 10387791 6. Get your kids organized with storage bins that can be easily pulled out during play time. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $54 .
ID: 10387804 7. And DIY a lego table with storage so they’ll always have a place for their favorite toys. designertrapped.com from Designer Trapped in a Lawyer’s Body .
ID: 10389295 8. Use a magnetic strip to store your hair supplies or tools within reach. amazon.com Get this one on Amazon for $40 .
ID: 10390736 9. Use your garage door to store your ladder and electrical cords with easily attachable hooks . View this image ›
amazon.com Best part, your garage door will still operate even when they’re on.
Get it on Amazon for $20 .
ID: 10387820 10. Add shelving to any wall to create more storage throughout your home. View this image ›
urbanoutfitters.com Get these shelves at Urban Outfitters starting at $10 . Or make your own with this tutorial from Designer Trapped in a Lawyer’s Body .
ID: 10389350 11. Store all your hair supplies in one neat, organized place with a holder that hangs off your cabinet door. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $18 .
ID: 10388174 12. Build up your cabinets to the ceiling for additional kitchen storage. remodelandolacasa.com from Remodelando la Casa .
ID: 10389245 13. Get a full-length mirror that doubles as jewelry storage. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $95 .
ID: 10388232 14. Use a shoe organizer to keep your cleaning supplies, pantry snacks, kid’s toys, or even your shoes in one, easily accessible, place. amazon.com , amazon.com Get this on on Amazon for $9 .
ID: 10390411 15. Or, keep those cleaning supplies and pantry snacks on a slide-out storage tower . amazon.com , amazon.com Get the three-tier version for $25 and the five-tier version for $50 on Amazon.
ID: 10388256 16. Use adjustable hooks throughout your home and position them to the side in smaller rooms to utilize less space. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $10 .
ID: 10390704 17. Create under-sink storage for your sponges and brushes with concealed trays . View this image ›
amazon.com Get them on Amazon starting at $18 .
Available in 11- and 14-inch options.
ID: 10388461 18. Or, just hook a shelf to your cabinet door to store extra sponges, brushes, and even paper towels. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $12 .
ID: 10390673 19. Use your foot ottoman to store your footwear. amazon.com Get it on Amazon starting at $60 .
Available in white, brown, and tan options.
ID: 10388506 20. Add exposed shelves to your kitchen island, giving you easy access to and a way to showcase your beautiful dishes. View this image ›
remodelandolacasa.com on Remodelando la Casa .
ID: 10389101 21. Get a compost bin that’s easily stored under your sink. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $35 .
ID: 10388520 22. Utilize the space under your bed with fabric storage bags that’ll protect your things and maximize the area. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $15 .
ID: 10387766 23. Or invest in a whole new bed that discreetly stores all those extras you want out of sight. amazon.com Get it on Amazon starting at $320 .
Available in full and queen bed options and in black.
ID: 10388140 24. Mount a towel rack to any wall to store your wine (or towels, I guess). amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $24 .
ID: 10389438 25. Hang a shelf-and-hook combo . Bonus if it has picture frames like this one! View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon starting at $23 .
Also available in white.
ID: 10389486 26. Mount a pot-lid rack to your cabinet doors. View this image ›
amazon.com Get this one on Amazon for $16 .
ID: 10389541 27. And store your pans on a rack to maximize storage space and protect their non-stick surfaces. amazon.com , amazon.com Get this one on Amazon for $15 .
ID: 10389553 28. Pour your dry foods from mountable food containers . View this image ›
amazon.com Get a set of three on Amazon for $35 .
ID: 10389569 29. Keep your baking sheets in a place (that isn’t the oven) with a basket that can be mounted or hung on your cabinet door. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $16 .
ID: 10389586 30. File away all your cleaning tools — or light sabers — with a broom holder . amazon.com , amazon.com Get this one Amazon for $11 .
ID: 10389613 31. Plant an extra closet nearly anywhere with these adjustable clothing racks that suction to the floor and ceiling. amazon.com , amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $70 .
ID: 10390318 32. Store and organize those hard-to-reach cabinets that have unused space with a pull-down spice rack . View this image ›
amazon.com Get this one on Amazon starting at $12 .
Also available in white and clear.
ID: 10390364 33. DIY a custom desk with plenty of shelving to get all the storage you’ll need. View this image ›
thehouseofsmiths.com Get the full Tutorial at The House of Smiths .
ID: 10390444 34. Attach small containers to the side of your washer and dryer to store all your laundry supplies. amazon.com Get it on Amazon starting at $10 .
Available in a variety of sizes and depths.
ID: 10390607 35. Have a place to store all your plastic bags with a super easy hook that clips onto your cabinet. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $10 .
ID: 10390682 36. And utilize every inch of space with a storage cabinet that mounts to the hinges of your door. amazon.com Get it on Amazon starting at $137 or DIY one with this tutorial from Remodelando la Casa.
Also available in espresso and for wine storage.
